page.title: 19RELICS OF THE WATERWORKS
page.content: {In Percy Road,}near the gate of Hampton Junior School{is an old {grating on which are the initials {"G.J.W.W."} This stands for the Grand Junction Water Works which was one of the three first water companies that set up pumping stations in Hampton in 1854. {In the Upper Sunbury Road there is {an archway on which is written {Southwark and Vauxhall Water Company. This was another of the original London water companies that came to Hampton in 1854. The original buildings, although now only used for storage are "listed" and are at present being restored. {On Platt's Eyot is a large hill {which was created when the soil {excavated during the constuction of {the filter beds in 1899 was dumped.
